definition: to lay one's cards on the table

sentences.english: Management are seeking a show-down with the unions on the issue of illegal strikes.
sentences.chinese: 資方正在就非法罷工問題與工會攤牌。

sentences.english: The US throwed two atomic bombs for force a showdown during the WWII.
sentences.chinese: 二戰期間美國投下兩顆原子彈迫使對方攤牌。

sentences.english: “Grandpa, ” I finally said to him recently, “you are 87 years old.
sentences.chinese: 最近我終於向他攤牌，“爺爺，你已經87歲了。

sentences.english: Today, I decided to tell my roommate how I really feel about her after a rude remark she made.
sentences.chinese: 今天我受不了室友的粗暴行爲了，於是跟她攤牌。

sentences.english: He told him that he had three days to hightail it or there'd turn into a showdown.
sentences.chinese: 艾頓通告他有三天的時間逃命，否則就是攤牌。

sentences.english: Eventually the National Guard is called in for a final showdown with the terrorizing rabbits.
sentences.chinese: 最終，是所謂的國民衛隊中的最後攤牌的恐嚇作用。

sentences.english: After having submitted to humiliation for many years, Tom finally had it out with his boss.
sentences.chinese: 忍氣吞聲了多年後，湯姆最終和他的老闆攤牌了。

sentences.english: Come late summer or early fall, a showdown between the President and Congress could be in the cards.
sentences.chinese: 到夏末秋初，總統和國會之間的攤牌就要來了。

sentences.english: Xu Wenqiang and Ding showdown break.
sentences.chinese: 許文強與丁力攤牌決裂。

definition: to question intensely/to interrogate/to demand information
to watch with amusement as sb makes a fool of himself
lit. lotus roots may break, but the fiber remains joined (idiom); lovers part, but still long for one another
(accounting) to balance the books/to do the accounts/(fig.) to settle an account/to get one's revenge
to have an acrimonious falling-out/to shed all pretense of cordiality/to tear into each other
to fall out with sb/to become hostile
see 直截了當|直截了当[zhi2 jie2 liao3 dang4]
lit. one palm alone cannot clap (proverb)/fig. it takes two persons to start a dispute/it takes two to tango/it's difficult to achieve anything without support
pinyin: yi1 ge5 ba1 zhang3 pai1 bu4 xiang3

definition: better to just get the pain over with, rather than prolong the agony
pinyin: chang2 tong4 bu4 ru2 duan3 tong4

definition: to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
angry words/sth said in the moment of anger
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
stuck together as by glue (of lovers)/joined at the hip
